docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Lowell E. Bellin, the city's Health Commissioner, submitted to the Board of Health yesterday a proposed resolution that would require all pharmacies in the city to maintain a medication history, or "drug profile," for every customer.

headline.main: City Urged to Make Pharmacies Keep Drug Profile of Customers; Invasion of Privacy Feared

docs.abstract: NYC Health Comr Lowell E Bellin submits to Bd of Health proposed resolution that will require all NYC pharmacies to maintain medication history, or 'drug profile,' for every customer; says resolution will protect well-being of patient by preventing over-use of medication, use of medication where 1 drug counteracts another and simultaneous use of drugs that could harm patient; bd member James L Curtis says drug profiles raise problem of invasion of privacy; NJ Bd of Pharmacy exec sec Paul Pumpian says similar NJ program is working well
docs.snippet: Dr. Lowell E. Bellin, the city's Health Commissioner, submitted to the Board of Health yesterday a proposed resolution that would require all pharmacies in the city to maintain a medication history, or "drug profile," for every customer.
